definition: lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/to remark upon a person's appearance/nitpicking/overcritical/judgmental
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: What do you hate being criticized about by guys?
sentences.chinese: 你也很討厭被男人評頭論足嗎？

sentences.english: The children made rude remarks about the old man.
sentences.chinese: 幾個孩子無禮地對那老人評頭論足。

sentences.english: Revision: You're criticising her dress sense. She might be offended.
sentences.chinese: 你對她的穿着評頭論足，她可能會不高興。

sentences.english: It would be rude to remark upon her appearance.
sentences.chinese: 對她評頭論足是不禮貌的。

sentences.english: You’re a fine one to criticize someone else’s appearance and personal hygiene.
sentences.chinese: 對他人外貌和個人衛生，你倒挺善於評頭論足的。

definition: lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
to whisper to one another's ear
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to have a high notion of one's duty/to be highly principled
